ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: nothing. i did not learn to write better in this class. actually i think i got worse.
I learned so much about decolonization and the history of race in the Caribbean.
Rasheed is an engaging lector with a brilliant mind. Class discussions followed student passions and the course was accessible and engaging to all

Composing and structuring essays in an effective manner, Analyzing and interpreting different pieces of texts. I also learned a lot about the role and importance of black and indigenous ecologies in the history of the world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The biggest strenght of this course is the instructor, Rasheed. He is an incredibly nice, caring and knowledgeable person. He has created an open and welcoming space in the classroom that really enables you to fully participate in the discussions. The readings were really interesting and the syllabus was structures extremely well with the readings building upon each other, making it possible to tie their content together progressing through the semester and making new connections.
Strengths: Very engaging, enjoyed the course more than I expected at the start of the semester. It has left me with a lot more interest to explore more about black and indigenous ecologies.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, The professor is wonderful and so nice and caring. As well it is a perfect opportunity to discuss and learn about complex themes with the help and guidance of your teacher and peers.

Yes! This course has been extremely great and I have fully enjoyed it. I usually dont enjoy writing credits but this course has been my favorite writing experience at Yale! Rasheed is an incredible professor and has created a classroom that makes you enjoy reading, discussing, and writing. The content was extremely interesting and I have learned a lot. The course also helped me create and form own arguments and thoughts and a better understanding about colonialism. This has been one of my favorite courses at Yale and I would highly recommend anyone to take it!
Yes! I would recommend it to anyone looking for an introductory writing class with some interest/curiosity about black and indigenous ecologies.
